questions.question: What is the main objective of the knapsack problem?

answers.a: To minimize the number of items selected
answers.b: To maximize the total value without exceeding capacity
answers.c: To maximize the total weight of items

explanations.a: The knapsack problem focuses on value optimization, not minimizing item count.
explanations.b: The correct objective is to maximize total value while respecting the weight constraint.
explanations.c: Maximizing weight is not the goal; weight is a limiting factor.
explanations.d: Selecting all items may exceed the knapsack capacity.

questions.question: In which type of knapsack problem are items allowed to be divided into smaller parts?

explanations.a: In 0/1 Knapsack, items are either fully selected or not selected.
explanations.b: Unbounded knapsack allows repetition, not division of items.
explanations.c: Fractional Knapsack allows items to be divided into fractions.
explanations.d: Bounded knapsack limits item count but does not allow fractions.

questions.question: Which algorithmic strategy is commonly used to solve the Fractional Knapsack problem?

explanations.a: Dynamic programming is used for 0/1 Knapsack, not Fractional Knapsack.
explanations.b: Divide and conquer is not suitable for this optimization problem.
explanations.c: Fractional Knapsack is optimally solved using a greedy approach.
explanations.d: Backtracking is inefficient for this problem.

questions.question: What does the value-to-weight ratio of an item represent?

explanations.a: Total profit alone does not consider the weight of the item.
explanations.b: The ratio includes both value and weight.
explanations.c: The value-to-weight ratio shows how much value is obtained per unit weight.
explanations.d: The ratio is unrelated to knapsack capacity.

questions.question: Why is sorting required in the Fractional Knapsack algorithm?

answers.a: To arrange items by increasing weight
answers.b: To arrange items by decreasing value
answers.c: To prioritize items with higher value-to-weight ratio

explanations.a: Weight alone is not sufficient for optimal selection.
explanations.b: Value alone does not ensure optimal use of capacity.
explanations.c: Sorting by value-to-weight ratio ensures maximum value gain.
explanations.d: Duplicate items are not a concern in this problem.

questions.question: What happens when an item does not completely fit into the remaining knapsack capacity in Fractional Knapsack?

answers.c: A fraction of the item is taken
answers.d: The algorithm stops without adding value

explanations.a: Skipping the item may reduce the total value.
explanations.c: A fraction of the item is taken to fully utilize remaining capacity.
explanations.d: The algorithm adds value using a fractional selection.

questions.question: Which property makes the greedy approach optimal for Fractional Knapsack?

explanations.a: Overlapping subproblems are associated with dynamic programming.
explanations.b: The greedy choice property ensures local optimal choices lead to a global optimum.
explanations.c: Recursion alone does not guarantee optimality.

questions.question: Which of the following constraints must always be satisfied in the knapsack problem?

answers.c: Total weight must not exceed capacity

explanations.a: The objective is to maximize value, not minimize it.
explanations.c: The total weight must always remain within the knapsack capacity.
explanations.d: Selecting all items may exceed capacity.

questions.question: Which of the following is an application of the Fractional Knapsack problem?

answers.a: Finding shortest path in a graph

explanations.a: Shortest path problems use graph algorithms.
explanations.b: Sorting is not an optimization under constraints.
explanations.c: Fractional knapsack is widely used in cargo and resource allocation problems.
explanations.d: Database searching is unrelated to knapsack optimization.

questions.question: What type of problem is the Fractional Knapsack problem classified as?

explanations.a: Decision problems focus on yes/no answers.
explanations.b: Searching problems aim to find an element.
explanations.c: Fractional Knapsack aims to optimize (maximize) total value.
explanations.d: Sorting is only a step, not the goal.
